Markdown Website Framework

Generate web pages from Markdown files and create static HTML

Home Page

Welcome

This content is rendered from the Markdown in markdown/index.md file. Modify it and refresh to see changes.

Adding new Pages

Add new folders with Markdown files in the markdown directory and navigate to them to automatically create new pages. For example, the markdown/pages/about.md file is loaded by visiting /pages/about.

PHP, Bootstrap 5, Twig

A starter Bootstrap 5 template is provided in templates/base.html.twig. Modify it to change header and footer elements. Also check out the templates/core/error.html.twig and not-found.html.twig templates to customize 500 and 404 error pages.

You can extend the framework functionality by adding new PHP controllers. Check out johnsquibb/php-microframework to learn more about using the framework that powers Markdown Website.

Cached HTML

After loading this page the cache directory should contain an index.html file with the full cache of this content, including header and footer. Relative links are automatically replaced with .html suffixes for connecting up all the pages.

See the project README.md for instructions on how to view the cached HTML content.
